title: HSBC plans sale of French retail banking business - Nasdaq.com
text: Sept 11 (Reuters) - HSBC  is planning to exit its French retail banking business under interim chief executive Noel Quinn, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.
The likeliest buyer for the unit would be a French bank looking to add market share, the WSJ, adding that the likely price for the business was not clear.
British bank HSBC would continue to offer wholesale banking operations in France, the WSJ added.
